page.title: 19Communications
page.content: Road, rail and waterways all pass through our area. The major road is the A57 joining Lincoln to Saxilby. This has been improved with the bends removed. Minor roads join the villages of Skellingthorpe and Burton to this main road. The new Lincoln Relief Road passes through the south of our area and includes bridge constructions to cross the Fossdyke and Railway close to the Pyewipe Inn. An elevated section then crosses farm land to the corner of Long Leys Road. The road is expected to be opened in 1986. The Railway line from Lincoln to Gainsborough passes close to the Fossdyke Canal. Crossing the canal by road is only possible at Saxilby or Lincoln. This has cut the area into two sections.
